documents.text: SpaceX was founded in 2002 by Elon Musk with the goal of reducing space transportation costs.
The aerospace company SpaceX, established in May 2002, has revolutionized rocket technology.

notes: No conflict - both sources agree on 2002

query: What is the population of Tokyo?

documents.text: Tokyo has a population of approximately 13.96 million people as of 2020.
The Greater Tokyo Area has over 37 million residents, making it the world's most populous metropolitan area.

notes: Numerical conflict due to different geographic definitions (city vs metro area)

query: Who is the CEO of Twitter?

documents.text: Jack Dorsey serves as CEO of Twitter, leading the social media platform.
Elon Musk completed his acquisition of Twitter and became CEO in October 2022.
Linda Yaccarino was appointed as CEO of X (formerly Twitter) in June 2023.

notes: Clear temporal conflict - leadership changed multiple times. Most recent source indicates Yaccarino.

documents.text: Thomas Edison invented the first commercially practical incandescent light bulb in 1879.
Humphry Davy invented the first electric light in 1802, though it was not practical for home use.
Joseph Swan demonstrated a working light bulb in 1878, before Edison's patent.

gold_answer: Multiple inventors contributed; Edison is most commonly credited for the practical version
notes: Entity conflict - multiple inventors mentioned. Requires historical context to resolve.

documents.text: Studies show moderate coffee consumption is associated with reduced risk of heart disease and type 2 diabetes.
Excessive coffee intake can lead to anxiety, insomnia, and increased blood pressure.
Coffee has been linked to both positive and negative health outcomes depending on consumption levels.

gold_answer: Moderate consumption appears beneficial; excessive consumption has risks
notes: Semantic conflict - qualitative health claims require nuanced interpretation

query: What is the speed of light?

documents.text: The speed of light in vacuum is exactly 299,792,458 meters per second.
Light travels at approximately 300,000 km/s or about 186,000 miles per second.

notes: No real conflict - one is exact, one is approximate. Both consistent.

query: When did World War II end?

documents.text: World War II ended on September 2, 1945, when Japan signed the surrender documents.
V-E Day (Victory in Europe) was celebrated on May 8, 1945, marking the end of WWII in Europe.

notes: Temporal conflict due to different theaters of war ending at different times

query: What is the tallest building in the world?

documents.text: The Burj Khalifa in Dubai stands at 828 meters, making it the world's tallest building.
Jeddah Tower, currently under construction, will surpass 1,000 meters when completed.

gold_answer: Burj Khalifa (currently completed); Jeddah Tower (when completed)
notes: Temporal aspect - depends on whether asking about current or future buildings

query: How many planets are in our solar system?

documents.text: Our solar system has eight planets: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
There are nine planets in the solar system, including Pluto.

gold_answer: 8 planets (Pluto reclassified as dwarf planet in 2006)
notes: Numerical conflict resolved by temporal context - IAU redefined planet in 2006

documents.text: Leading AI researchers have signed statements warning about existential risks from advanced AI systems.
AI technology offers tremendous benefits for healthcare, education, and scientific research.
The risks of AI are overstated and distract from more immediate concerns like bias and job displacement.

gold_answer: Opinions vary; both opportunities and risks exist
notes: Highly semantic conflict - interpretive disagreement on qualitative risk assessment
